History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
A motion was made that this Introduction be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
History.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on General Orders with Message of Necessity

History.Description: This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted

Attachments.Name: December 15, 2021 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - December 15, 2021
Legislative Documents - Letter to the Mayor

Summary: This bill would co-name 199 thoroughfares and public places, based on requests of Council Members whose district includes the location.  Of these 199 co-names, 16 are either a relocation of a previously enacted co-naming or a revision to the street sign installed with respect to a previously enacted co-naming.
Text:

      Section 1. The following street name, in the Borough of Manhattan, is hereby designated as hereafter indicated.
